caption: Saloon is the perfect place.
Best place for a chill beer and chat on u street
Great prices. Fun bar atmosphere
Cool owner, nice style and atmosphere, quite place to hang out and have a drink or two, the owner helps out underprivileged kids , the moonshine is really delicious
been here like 10 times over the years-- unique beer selection, but the bartender (who seemed like the owner) was terribly rude last time i went. just need a beer ,dude, not the attitude
It's a great place to drink and hang out with friends
Simple bar great if you have a small group of friends.
Cool bar with good food

Walk down a few steps into a place where Belgian Trappists meet Syrian/Ethiopian clerics for a Cold brew, garlic fried favas, and perhaps a game of backgammon. No martinis and no TV! Keep your phone in your pocket. Luxurious service. Exotic and extensive beer list plus moonshine & classical music. Open your heart.
Rudest place in the District
Props to The Saloon for being a not-for-profit pub and building schools in other countries.  Great beer selection.
Amazing bar and beer, great atmosphere. A social enterprise using profits to build schools around the world
This might be my new favorite bar. It's simple, well-lit, and there is no pounding music. All profits go to building schools.

This place is fantastic. It's a quiet, casual island in the middle of the chaos that is U St. They sell a great selection of Belgian beers and house moonshine specials (try the boozy blueberries). It has a funky, off-kilter vibe, epitomized by the series of tongue-in-cheek rules posted around the bar and in the menu.  The best part, though, is that they occasionally close for a month at a time! Because they're using the profits from the bar to go build schools on other continents. Get your name on a brick for a donation!

My absolute favorite pub in DC--the owner uses the profits to help build schools and provide proper flooring for homes around the world, so you can drink here knowing you're helping a good cause! Definitely get the garlic fava beans with your drink--I want to come back to DC just to get some more to take home. There is also a great/cheap Tuesday steak dinner special here, perfect after a hard day of work!
Fun super dive bar but great location, not crowded, and unique "non-profit"status.
Love this place! Great drinks and nice vibe. Will definitely be back!

I "discovered" this place just recently while wandering down U Street.  I poked my head in and was immediately hooked.  A unique bar/foundation with a great cause to help build schools around the world.  Great pub food, nice beer selection, and a unique atmosphere.  It's a new favorite!
Amazing for the moonshine, Urbock bier, and mission to build schools!
Somehow crazy but special. I am still not sure if their story is authentic or just a business strategy but we liked it a lot there :)
Great place to meet and talk over great drinks.
Intimate bar and they serve food too! It also functions as a non-profit. Our server mentioned the owner has been involved with multiple school building projects oversees.

My favorite bar in DC. Fantastic atmosphere and drinks, and it’s a nonprofit pub, where all proceeds go to building schools for needy people around the world, so you’ll feel good about ordering another round.
One of, if not THE, best bars in DC!
A great hidden gem of DC. Once you've been here, you won't forget the place. They have no social media or website. Very old school, and a great unique place to visit. Great beer selection.
Awesome
Hands down one of the best bars in the world.
So many rules. Dry and old atmosphere.

This is a very weird bar that I stumbled into after getting dinner at Ben's Chili Bowl. I'm giving it 5 starts for the overall uniqueness of it at a time where every bar seems to be following the same trends. You're unlikely to find a bar like this again.  They focus on German beers, served by the half pint, and all their profits go towards supporting construction projects in developing countries. When I arrived I was the only patron and the bartender was really friendly. It almost felt like an episode of Cheers. I'd have stayed longer but had other places to see - if I lived nearby I'd come here often. If you're visiting it's worth stopping in for a drink and a story. They have a little knickknack display by the bathrooms where you can buy a very unique souvenir.
Nonprofit dive bar. Crazy concept but very cool and good selection of beer.  Always feel free to reach out to me on Twitter @joerazz
Decent place, unique atmosphere and ownership.  Lot of community support, in and out of US by ownership.  No television, but good selection of beers and decent food.
Good drinks, tasty food.  Nice room upstairs for private affairs. Clean bathrooms.  Bar supports charity that builds schools in poor areas. Entire staff participates in school effort.
One of the only places to get get good German beer on tap!
Beer and rules.
Great place if you want something a little more low key. Awesome beer selection, I really like the burger, and check out the spicy boiled peanuts.
Very cosy place for drinking beer and to sit nd have a talk. They donate a lot to humanitarian projects around the world, so you know your money are well spent.

An innocuous gem on U street with a good beer list, decent food and a laid back atmosphere. I'd call it a dive bar, but the food & drink selections preclude that. A good place to hit pre-show at any of the venues in the area (Lincoln, Black Cat, etc.).
Great bar
Steak salad and fries $12!
Like their charitable focus on top of having good beers.
Great mission. Refreshing to see such an establishment give back to communities around the world. Nice, quiet atmosphere and nice selection of beer.
Non-profit Bar. What a concept!  Nice atmosphere and service too.

Super cool nonprofit bar that helps establish schools in less developed parts of the world. Beer selection is small but they are good beers and their moonshine is top notch and delicious. Plus you have to try their alcohol soaked fruits like pineapple and blueberries.
Excellent mission, great food and beer. I love supporting this place!
My favorite bar in the city. Amazing beers, service, and atmosphere. On top of all that it's a nonprofit organization that builds schools in third world countries. Come and you'll be hooked.
By far my favorite bar in DC. Quiet music, great beer selection, and all the proceeds go towards building schools! A non profit bar!
Excellent food, beer, and atmosphere. No cell phones, no TV, no standing, no problem.

This place feels like it exists out of time. You walk in and you're hit with a nostalgia that isn't your own (unless this is your local joint). Interesting selection of German, Belgian, and Austrian beers, including the deliciously rare Urbock 23° on tap. Nuggets of wisdom printed simply on computer paper and hung on the brick walls create an atmosphere resembling the inside of your grandfather's meandering mind. Bar munchies include delicious spicy peanuts, garlic fava beans, and wasabi peas. The best part is knowing that all proceeds go toward building schools in struggling regions around the world. Your time and money are well spent in this U Street hideaway.
Good selection of beer. Must try the drunken blueberries.
definitely talk to the owner, this place is one of a kind
Neat bar that subtly ask for donations
This is a great bar, that also gives to charity. Quirky atmosphere with great service. Great beer, mulled wine, and funky moonshine without being overpriced!
Nice selection of beer and reasonably priced food.
A quirky.fun distraction on the u st corridor
I left my wallet in
Love the rules
A must experience in the U St area!

This place is definitely a to-each-his-own kind of establishment. Personally I am fine with the "rules" but I can understand how someone else might find them offensive. You are, after all, the customer, and you are paying for your drinks and food. I do like the social consciousness of the place but I also feel like they could do as much good for humanity without kicking people out of the bar who look at their cell phones.  Pro tip: Ask to sit upstairs. It's less crowded.

The beer here costs as much as at any bar in DC, and part of the profit goes to build schools around the world.  It's a win-win proposition.  Also, "the rules" - no standing, no yelling, no cell phones - make for a pleasant atmosphere where you can actually have a conversation.  The kitchen has a limited selection, but what they make is good.  Pay the dollar to touch the cow.
Very close to the clubs and has some veggie food options.
Great food and drinks for a good cause
Party of your bill hours to building schools overseas. Try some of the funky things the owner has thought up. The moonshine will knock you on your ass
This place is amazing.
Donating to charity with a drink, what's better?
I work there so yeah.
I only tried the beers on tap, but it was a good range and I enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. Would return for drinks in the future with friends!
Best customer service and they're building schools for children all over the world from the profits.  I really appreciate everything about this bar. One of my favorite. Thanks a lot!

One of the best bars I've ever been to. It was very refreshing to be at an establishment that encourages conversation and genuine interaction. The bartenders were very friendly and conversed with every patron. It was the perfect atmosphere for relaxing, enjoying good drinks and talking. The drinks were a tad pricey, but that is to be expected at any place on U street. To me, it helped having money go towards a good cause (the bar is non-profit and the owner builds schools once a year.)  Overall, a great experience and I will definitely return.
Good beer selection. The hot wings were said to be "unique" and they were uniquely small and bland. I think the bar tender was drunk but that's ok

The bartender/owner, Commy Jahanbein, is a jackass that was not only rude to my pregnant self when I asked what kind of non-alcoholic drinks they serve (by saying "this is a bar") but kicked me out as well. Guess he's only nice to children in developing counties the bar donates money to, a fact that is advertised to everyone all the time at nauseum.
Interesting place with "strict" rules. Good, quick service.

Had a great time here last night even just stopping by to pass some time. Good beer and fantastic atmosphere. They make sure it doesn't lose the charm with the no standing / tv / cell phone rules. Love it! Haven't tried the food but it smelled good.
The New York Strip Steak Dinner Special every Tuesday is great!
Great bar with great beer selection and prices. Even on St. Patricks Day.
Love the atmosphere and the beer.

I don't drink alcohol, but this is one of the few bars I'm fine with going to.  It's all about the conversation here- no TVs; no distractions.  The owner can seem a bit gruff & indifferent, but he's actually quite friendly & philanthropic.  He closes for a month each year so he can help build a school somewhere around the world.

This is a place for beer and conversation. Solid draft beer list, mostly european. The soup-nazi version of beer bars. No standing in the bar--really. Everyone must be seated. No TVs, so you can talk, read or whatever. The food is fine for what it is, bar food.
Good range of beers.
